title: Ticket #2148: kill_sig only works once in vanilla universe.
description:
When I specify kill_sig for a vanilla job, then first time it vacates I get the signal specified. After the job goes to idle, then reruns, I fail to get the signal again at vacate time. It is as if the signal is only sent on the FIRST vacate boundary.

I was told the signal handling semantics for jobs changed very recently, so this could be an introduced bug.
remarks:
2011-May-10 11:15:12 by tannenba:
So strange.

Pete, esp since you have a simple test for this, please add a regression test to detect this problem. Could this be related to work done in #1198 ? If it is, I suppose a regression test would figure that out.

2011-May-10 11:50:11 by psilord:
Hrm, when I pared down my shell script to produce a small example, the problem went away and I received the signals as expected. So, likely the problem is in my shell script, but I won't abandon this ticket until I can confirm where the bug is.

2011-May-10 14:34:54 by psilord:
Ok, I will abandon this ticket.

The "bug" I found was that the shell wasn't flushing all of its output before dying and it took the output with it that I was expecting. I did a terrible hack in the shell script to slow it down before dying and now see the output that I expect.
creator: psilord
